metadata.title: CVE-2022-34169 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The Apache Xalan Java XSLT library is vulnerable to an integer truncationissue when processing malicious XSLT stylesheets. This can be used tocorrupt Java class files generated by the internal XSLTC compiler andexecute arbitrary Java bytecode. Users are recommended to update to version2.7.3 or later. Note: Java runtimes (such as OpenJDK) include repackagedcopies of Xalan.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34169` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openjdk-8-demo - 8u342-b07-0ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-8-jdk - 8u342-b07-0ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-8-jdk-headless - 8u342-b07-0ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-8-jre - 8u342-b07-0ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-8-jre-headless - 8u342-b07-0ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-8-jre-zero - 8u342-b07-0ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-8-source - 8u342-b07-0ubuntu1~18.04
No subscription required

openjdk-11-demo - 11.0.16+8-0ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-11-jdk - 11.0.16+8-0ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-11-jdk-headless - 11.0.16+8-0ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-11-jre - 11.0.16+8-0ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-11-jre-headless - 11.0.16+8-0ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-11-jre-zero - 11.0.16+8-0ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-11-source - 11.0.16+8-0ubuntu1~18.04
No subscription required

openjdk-17-demo - 17.0.4+8-1~18.04
openjdk-17-jdk - 17.0.4+8-1~18.04
openjdk-17-jdk-headless - 17.0.4+8-1~18.04
openjdk-17-jre - 17.0.4+8-1~18.04
openjdk-17-jre-headless - 17.0.4+8-1~18.04
openjdk-17-jre-zero - 17.0.4+8-1~18.04
openjdk-17-source - 17.0.4+8-1~18.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxalan2-java: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
openjdk-8 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8u342-b07-0ubuntu1~18.04').
icedtea-web: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
openjdk-lts package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '11.0.16+8-0ubuntu1~18.04').
openjdk-17 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '17.0.4+8-1~18.04').
